metadata.Title: CVE-2017-0455 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description: An information disclosure vulnerability in the Qualcomm bootloader could help to enable a local malicious application to to execute arbitrary code within the context of the bootloader. This issue is rated as High because it is a general bypass for a bootloader level defense in depth or exploit mitigation technology. Product: Android. Versions: Kernel-3.18. Android ID: A-32370952. References: QC-CR#1082755.

notes.Note: seth-arnold> I have trouble correlating the description with the patch; is this correct?

criterions.comment: android: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
